title: TC001-Access Control - Authenticated User Can Access /painel Routes
description: Verify that users authenticated via localStorage key isAuthenticated=true can access all /painel routes.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Access Denied: Authentication Required').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Users authenticated via localStorage key isAuthenticated=true should access all /painel routes and see the painel dashboard and editors. This assertion fails immediately to indicate the test plan execution failure.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC002-Access Control - Unauthorized User Blocked from /painel Routes
description: Verify that unauthenticated users (localStorage isAuthenticated absent or false) are blocked from accessing /painel routes.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Clear localStorage key 'isAuthenticated' or set it to false via script, then click 'Área Administrativa' link to try to access /painel route
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Área Administrativa' link to try to access /painel route after clearing localStorage
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/header/div/div[2]/div/a[6]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try to open a new tab and navigate to the homepage (http://localhost:5173/) to restore a valid page state, then clear localStorage key 'isAuthenticated' or set it to false, and retry accessing a valid deep sub route under /painel.
        await page.goto('about:blank', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Clear localStorage key 'isAuthenticated' or set it to false explicitly via script, then directly navigate to a valid deep sub route under /painel (e.g., /painel/dashboard) to test access control.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/painel/dashboard', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Bem-vindo de volta! Faça login para continuar.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=EMAIL').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=SENHA').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Entrar').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Não tem conta? Cadastre-se').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC003-HomeEditor - Edit and Save Home Content Successfully
description: Verify that updating content in HomeEditor and saving persists data to Supabase and updates public site immediately.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on 'Área Administrativa' link to navigate to the admin panel for home editing.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Área Administrativa' link to go to admin panel
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/header/div/div[2]/div/a[6]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input email and password, then click 'Entrar' button to authenticate.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('adminpassword')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Entrar' button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Content update successful and persisted to Supabase').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Updating content in HomeEditor and saving did not persist data to Supabase or update the public site immediately as expected.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC006-Dynamic Pages - List, Add, Update Status, and Delete
description: Validate that dynamic page management supports listing, adding new pages, updating page statuses and deletion with persistence and immediate public site reflection.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on 'Área Administrativa' link to access the admin panel for dynamic pages.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Área Administrativa' link to access admin panel
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/header/div/div[2]/div/a[6]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input email and password, then click 'Entrar' to authenticate.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('adminpassword')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Entrar' button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Dynamic Page Successfully Added').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test plan execution failed: Dynamic page management test failed to list, add, update, or delete pages with persistence and immediate public site reflection.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None

    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)

                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Set localStorage isAuthenticated = true and navigate to /painel/home to test access granted.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/painel/home', timeout=10000)

    finally:

                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers

            ],
        )

            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well

            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on 'Área Administrativa' link to go to the admin panel for dynamic pages management.
        frame = context.pages[-1]

        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input valid credentials and click the login button to authenticate.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input admin email for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div/main/div/div/div/form/div/input').nth(0)

    finally:
